definition: to form one's own group or school of thought/to set up one's own business/to establish oneself
self/oneself/from/since/naturally/surely
surname Li
to stand/to set up/to establish/to lay down/to draw up/at once/immediately

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
surname Men
a household/door/family

sentences.english: Remember that God sets us to our (His) tasks, and we dare not presume to arrogate any tasks to ourselves apart from Him.
sentences.chinese: 记住是神给我们分配任务，我们怎敢离开神自立门户。

sentences.english: Projects which create forks should be thinking about merging back from the outset.
sentences.chinese: 自立门户的项目也应该想着要合并回去。

sentences.english: One of the big assumptions brought into this debate is that forking is a bad thing.
sentences.chinese: 这场讨论的一个重大假设是，自立门户是一件坏事。

sentences.english: He encouraged his apprentices to set themselves up in business, and a culture of watchmaking developed.
sentences.chinese: 他鼓励他的学徒自立门户，从而发展出制表文化。

sentences.english: Projects which create forks also need to think about their processes.
sentences.chinese: 自立门户的项目也需要思考他们的流程。

definition: to live apart from parents (of married couple)/to achieve independence
lit. to set up a separate kitchen (idiom); to start from scratch/back to square one/to start of on a new path
to work on one's own/to work single-handed/individual farming
to seek shelter/to seek asylum
to rely on help from sb
to improve one's family's social status by moving up in the world/to switch one's allegiance to a new patron
to get a better job somewhere else (idiom)/to seek alternative employment
to exercise sole hegemony (idiom); to dominate a whole area (market, resources etc)/to hold as one's personal fiefdom
to take up sb's mantle/to follow in sb's steps
to have a falling out/to have a big argument
to lay down a family fortune/to get rich/to become prosperous
to take over/to take control
to recruit soldiers and buy horses (idiom); to raise a large army/fig. to expand business/to recruit new staff
to separate and live apart/division of a large family into smaller groups
to leave home to make one's way in the world/to leave the life one knows to seek success
to leave home/to go off/to run away
